text: Chediak in 1964 Braz Chediak (June 1, 1942, Três Corações) is a Brazilian actor, screenwriter and filmmaker. With Aurélio Teixeira, he was responsible for the argument and the script of the film Mineirinho, Live or Dead (1967),Cinemateca Brasileira Mineirinho, Vivo ou Morto [em linha] and the adaptation of Meu Pé de Laranja Lima in 1970. Of all the films that he directed include Razor in the Flesh, Two lost in a Dirty Night, Cute But Ordinary and Forgive Me for Betraying Me, among others. He has chronicles published in several newspapers. His tale The Golden Bit is published by Editora Record in the anthology Crime Made in Home. His novel, Cortina de Sangue, is published by Editora Mirabolante and has great critical and public success.Vida de Leitor: Cortina de Sangue — Braz Chediak ==References== ==External links== * *Biography on adorocinemabrasileiro.com Category:1942 births Category:Living people Category:People from Três Corações Category:Brazilian actors Category:Brazilian screenwriters Category:Brazilian filmmakers
